meanings.definition: precookers (noun): People or machines that cook food in advance.
meanings.sent1: The precookers at the restaurant prepare meals ahead of time.
meanings.sent2: The industrial precookers in the kitchen help speed up the cooking process.
meanings.sent3: The precookers at the party had all the food ready before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: She was like a precooker, always planning and preparing things in advance.
meanings.sent5: The army of precookers in the cafeteria ensured that everyone got their meals quickly.

meanings.definition: precookers (verb): To cook food in advance.
meanings.sent1: I like to precook my meals on Sundays for the whole week.
meanings.sent2: She precooks the pasta the night before to save time for dinner.
meanings.sent3: He decided to precook the entire Thanksgiving dinner to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent4: The chef precooks the ingredients to streamline the cooking process during busy hours.
meanings.sent5: Precooking the vegetables allows them to be easily added to the stir-fry later.
